page.title: 17FARMING:EASTLANDS FARM.
page.content: In the Cowfold area there are 28 farms.One of them is Eastlands Farm owned by Mr.Jim Kingston.It is a dairy farm of 163 acres.It is worth Â£2000 an acre.He has 130 cows all British Friesians worth about Â£500 each.He has a bull named Jerry who is worth Â£700. Jerry came second in The South Of England Show in 1985.Each cow gives 10 litres of milk a day.The milk is put in a bulk tank which holds 2000 litres.The milk is collected each day by tanker lorry.Mr.Kingston mixes treacle and the left over centres of Mars Bars with the cattle feed.Mr. Kingston's day begins at 6 a.m.He feeds the calves,milks the cows and has his breakfast.He spends the day cutting grass to make silage,trimming hedges and in many other tasks.The cows are milked again at 6 p.m.He goes to bed at 10 p.m. after a hard day.
